duties_responsibilities.duty: Independently conduct expert investigations and handle complex fraud referrals.
Perform complex corporate investigations in the field in a professional manner.
Develop and document information on any investigation, file review, or other project by writing clear, concise reports, memos, and letters.
Have working knowledge and understanding of anti-fraud laws, insurance regulations, and compliance rules.
Conduct virtual interviews in place of in-person interviews.
Outline game plans for assignment objectives and communicate to clients and the SIU Supervisor.
Offer expert advice to clients regarding SIU investigations.
Conduct fraud awareness training for clients and others.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree in criminal justice or related field and 4 years demonstrated experience conducting complex insurance investigations or adjusting complex claims.
OR a minimum of 5 years of experience in law enforcement, military law enforcement, or government/private investigations.
Successful completion of the Allied Universal Investigations PI Training/orientation course.
Possession of a current and valid driver’s license.
Proficiency in Outlook, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
Private Investigator’s license required in specific states prior to applying.
